meanings.definition: A line at the beginning of a newspaper or magazine article giving the writer's name
meanings.sent1: The byline at the top of the article showed the author's name clearly.
meanings.sent2: I always look for the byline to see who wrote the article.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky mouse added his name as the byline on the newspaper article.
meanings.sent4: Her byline shone brightly among the other writers in the magazine.
meanings.sent5: The byline acted as a spotlight, showcasing the author's identity.

meanings.definition: To credit a writer with authorship of an article
meanings.sent1: The editor decided to byline the new writer for her exceptional work.
meanings.sent2: It is important to byline the correct author for each article.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to byline himself as the author of the famous story.
meanings.sent4: Bylining the talented writer elevated the quality of the publication.
meanings.sent5: She always makes sure to byline the deserving writers for their contributions.
